parameters: <WordWrap>I used to use this to tenderize our steaks we would have every so often. It was a good way to let out my anger on something safe. Now I just use it to \c[4]DESTROY\c[0] our house
<wordwrap>I can’t go outside in this mood, I wouldn’t want to snap at my neighbours. They don’t deserve that.
<wordwrap>Better go make something to eat in the \c[4]kitchen\c[0] instead.
<WordWrap>I don’t think I have the energy to go out there right now.
<WordWrap>I’m better off going to the \c[4]music room\c[0] to finish that song we were working on
<wordwrap>I can hardly stand to get out of my bed let alone go outside.
<wordwrap>Instead, I’ll grab some winter gear from the \c[4]basement\c[0] so I can at least be warm.
<wordwrap>Can’t wait for her to get back so we can start watching. This show has been
<wordwrap>It’s been a while since she left. I wonder how much longer she’s going to be?
<WordWrap>We’ll never get the chance to finish that show now. Or anything else.
Damn it. \|Damn it\. Damn it\. DAMN IT!
<WordWrap>If only I stopped her from going to the store that night, we would be still sitting down to watch shows every night.
<WordWrap>While she died, I was sitting here looking at this screen like an idiot.
<WordWrap>Maybe I’ll try watching that show we were gonna start a year ago.
I heard the end wasn’t that great though.

<WordWrap>It’s summer now. I always disliked summer but she loved to drag me out on adventures.
<WordWrap>And some bastard in a car took that away from me
<WordWrap>Am I ever gonna feel normal again?
<WordWrap>Winter? It’s almost been a year since I’ve been wallowing in this pit. No less than I deserve though.
Back to spring.\. Where it all began.
<wordwrap>My favourite part of the house. Bringing the couch over and sitting beside
it is the best during winter.\| Fireplace channel be damned.
<WordWrap>The worst part of the house. Useless in summer and now useless without someone to enjoy sitting beside it with. I despise this place.
<WordWrap>We searched for so long for a place with a beautiful fireplace like this. I would have settled for a hovel as long as she was there.
<WordWrap>I haven’t used this since last year. I don’t think I could sit by the fire again like we did before.
<WordWrap>It won’t the same without her to sit by the fire with me but she loved that we had it and it would be a shame not to use it every so often.

<WordWrap>Her teddy bear from childhood. Her parents gave me this at the funeral.
<WordWrap>What do I do with it? I’d rather have the person than any of these things.

<wordwrap>They must be going through the same pain I am and yet they can keep going. They’re strong where I’m pathetic.

<wordwrap>None of these people cared for her as much as I did. Only there to say empty condolences.
<WordWrap>All these condolences mean little when I would trade all these words for just one more from her.
<WordWrap>All these people are also hurting and here I can only think about myself. I don’t deserve their condolences
<WordWrap>I really should have relied on all these people over the last year instead of trying to deal with it by myself. Thank god the therapist kept an eye on me.
<WordWrap>I know we bought this house as a fixer-upper and have been busy but man do we need
<WordWrap>She hated these shitty drapes. I would tear them down right now if they weren’t the only things keeping the light out in the mornings.
<WordWrap>We were supposed to replace these and fix up this house.
<WordWrap>If only I could go back I would have made this place just like we wanted so she could have seen it.
<WordWrap>Maybe I’ll keep these here forever.\. As a reminder.
<WordWrap>I think after meeting the therapist I’ll go look for new drapes.

<wordwrap>What do I do when nearly everything I see reminds me of her?

<WordWrap>If it meant getting my wife back, I would climb a thousand of these.
<WordWrap>Why did this have to be our last major trip together? I complained the whole time and only made it worse. She must have been annoyed.
<WordWrap>Man, I hated this trip so much but in hindsight, it was a great time.

<WordWrap>There was never going to be a happily ever after.
